review: No fuss, no hassle.  It took me about 20 minutes to figure out how to get this going with my laptop - you have to install the Google-cast to the Chrome web browser and then you are off and away.This is not as iPad friendly as I was hoping, but I imagine that will change here with an app update soon.All in all. for $30.00, this is the cheapest way to stream to your tv!
author: jedi008 "jedi_008"

review: The Chromecast is slick, and for the price you can't go wrong.  One thing I have noticed is that it doesn't do well handling connection interruptions or periodic reduction in speed/bandwidth on the wireless network.  My router can sometimes be finicky and instead of buffering or pausing a video, the Chromecast usually stops entirely and crashes the app that's controlling playback.  I understand this is entirely my issue with the router (hence the still 4 star rating) but the error handling and/or buffering process could be improved, in my opinion.

review: What else to say? This has rendered my Xbox 360 completely obsolete. Until I'm ready to purchase the newer Xbox (I never get them in the early phase anyway) I can remove my xbox live account and save the money. This is easily controlled by an iOS or Android device and streams with perfect video quality. I'm thoroughly impressed. I bought it, set it up and it updated immediately to the newest software and works great. The video quality is clearly higher than streaming from my xbox also.
